CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :

“ The fundamental rights and freedoms of man and citizen enshrined in ORG DATE of the LAW can be restricted only by law if necessary for the protection of ORG security and public safety , the public order , the health and morals of society , and the rights , freedoms , honour and good name of others . ”

“ CARDINAL . NORP In specific cases the Government defines categories of citizens and particular individuals to be granted deferral from conscription to compulsory military service . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
“ All civic obligations envisaged by law apply equally to believing members of religious organisations as they do to other citizens .

In specific cases of contradiction between civic obligations and religious convictions , the matter of discharging one 's civic obligations can be resolved by means of an alternative principle , in the procedure prescribed by law , by mutual agreement between the relevant ORG authority and the given religious organisation . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW , with their subsequent amendments introduced on DATE , read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Alternative service , within the meaning of this LAW , is the service replacing the compulsory fixed - period military service which does not involve the carrying , keeping , maintenance and use of arms , and which is performed both in military and civilian institutions .

CARDINAL . Alternative service includes the following types : ( a ) alternative military [ service , namely ] military service performed in the armed forces of GPE which does not involve being on combat duty , and the carrying , keeping , maintenance and use of arms ; and ( b ) alternative labour [ service , namely ] the labour service performed outside the armed forces of GPE .

CARDINAL . The purpose of alternative service is to ensure the fulfilment of a civic obligation before the motherland and society and it does not have a punitive , depreciatory and degrading nature . ”

“ CARDINAL . An NORP citizen , whose creed or religious beliefs do not allow him to carry out military service in a military unit , including the carrying , keeping , maintenance and use of arms , can perform alternative service . ”
